title: Riot, you seriously need to help David Hayter
body:
He's currently suffering from serious career problems despite being one of the most iconic video game voice actors known for his role as Solid Snake from Metal Gear series. Basically Hayter has no big roles right now after the mess happened with Konami and Hideo Kojima who pulled a bad trick on Hayter (he's still very upset about it), yet he would really like to voice some cool character in another videogame. We already have Raiden as Jhin(Quinton Flynn), why don't we bring Snake too? I'm a big fan of his Snake, I know that I can't be the only one here. It would actually be a big thing if together we managed to help that great actor even a little.
http://cdn3.dualshockers.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/maxresdefault-1.jpg

Blue Moon Wolf suggested Hayter for Yorick's {{champion:83}} rework. And you know what? It sounds like an absolutely brilliant idea to me.

Hate to be the bearer of narcissism here but, I find this is what is wrong with the world. Just because someone has money, and has done something before doesn't mean he should automatically be put on a pedestal everywhere he goes and given free rides. He should apply to Riot or contact them on his own as an ADULT. There are many other people out there in voice acting who cannot get a job because nobody gives new people a chance despite them working just as hard as old timers. Why? because old timers are given freebies everywhere they go just based off their name.

It actually slows the process of growth in society. 

Maybe he doesn't have any big roles right now because they're better people for the job out there who god forbid you haven't heard about.

On the other hand, voice actors are not disposable, identical products; each one has their own brand of voice. If people want to specifically have him in the game in some form or fashion and voice their opinion to Riot, that's also Free Market Capitalism and Riot is free to weigh the costs and benefits of hiring him vs another brand.

The problem comes from collusion in companies, not brand loyalty.
Yeah? Of all things, _this_ is what's wrong with the world?
I gurentee you that I can think of 100 things worse than new voice actors having a hard time trying to make their mark in the business.

I highly doubt Sutherland's cost had that much of a factor on his lack of dialogue. Konami is valued at over 3 billion making them easily one of the top 10 richest video game developers in the world and MGSV had a budget of 80 million, the 19th highest budget of any video game ever. 

Poorer companies have hired more famous actors on much shorter budgets for much larger roles. Ellen Page in Beyond: Two Souls for example or any given Kingdom Hearts game.

There was no bad trick, Kojima never liked how Hayter portrayed Snake, he did not capture the feeling at all that Kojima wanted for Snake so whenever there was a chance Kojima tried tosee if hecould be replaced so an actor who could carry the lines better would take over, when MGS5 came along Kojima was able to get Sutherland whom's voice he preferred over Hayter so Hayter was replaced. Remember the way everything was designed around for the most part is the Japanese version, in MGS4 Akio Otsuka who plays snake, did the motion capture and hugged his father Chikao Otsuka for the scene with big boss and snake.

He fired Hayter because he argued with him too much about the weak plot of MGS4 and how the series are taking wrong direction after Tomokazu Fukushima stopped writing the script for MGS. He cared about his character and wanted Kojima to listen to him, but Kojima wanted memes and fanservice.
